reviews.review_msg: Due to small class sizes, Cynthia gives every student individualized feedback/attention which is very helpful. That being said, the workload is very intense and there is a lot more work than expected.

Cynthia is a great prof who really wants her students to do well. As its a small class, she pays attention to the individual growth of every student. A LOT of homework, but that's how you improve in a language. vocab quizzes, unit tests, and in-class participation are required. Carry an open mind and you'll have a good time and see improvement!

Cynthia is a decent prof overall. However, the class was slightly unorganized and left many wondering what is expected for homework and tests. Lectures are mandatory and be prepared to be randomly chosen for participation. This being said, Cynthia explained course concepts clearly was always open for questions.

This is a class for those with Chinese heritage but I am a complete foreigner, so the course was a bit challenging for me. Prof was really helpful and easy to reach out to. This is a language course so it's fair that there are many assignments, be prepared for that.

pretty good prof, very nice and understanding, prepares and tells you what will be on a test or exam. has a lot of background information on many words or concepts that she teaches, which helps you understand better. if you keep on top of homework and studying vocab, you'll def get an A in this class. :)
Excellent teacher, very friendly and dedicated to her students. It is very easy to get along with her and she throws in (and tolerates) plenty of humour in her classes.
